fields.description:
We got several reports of bugs in GH from different users and this proved to be false bugs because they had one of the quick filters pressed but they were not able to see this on screen. Neither we... and it took quite some time to find out why.

Please change the CSS so it is clearly visible when a quick filter is pressed or not.
fields.summary: Active current board filters are not clearly visible in the UI
'Refine report' date pickers now inconsistent - do not allow edit of input
Date picker in Kanban Release dialog now inconsistent - cannot edit input directly

fields.description: Using a filter, I'd like to be able to assign custom column colors. This way, I could go from white to yellow to orange to red (contrary to the predefined colors used now), similarly to the way card colors are configurable.
fields.summary: Custom column colors

fields.description:
As an admin user 

I would like the ability to restrict the "Remove from Sprint" option to specific groups / roles

So that I can ensure the Product Owner is the only group / role that can remove issues from a sprint
fields.summary: Restrict "Remove from Sprint" Ability

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are issues appearing in the Sprint Report as "Removed from Sprint", which are completed, and have *not* been removed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to reproduce this as of yet.

h3. Expected Results

The issues appear in the "Completed Issues" section of the report.

h3. Actual Results

The issues appear in the "Issues Removed From Sprint" section of the report.

h3. Notes

This behaviour appears to be occurring due to a condition where the sprint history records are missing as the sprint was added during issue creation, potentially between the dates of the sprint. Unfortunately not able to replicate to properly identify this behaviour.

h3. Workaround

# Edit the issue to remove the sprint and save it.
# Add the issue back into the sprint. It will now appear in the correct section of the Sprint Report.
(!) Note that the issue will have a * against the issue key in the Sprint Report as GreenHopper will consider it as added to the Sprint after the sprint was started.
fields.summary: Issues that are completed are showing up as "Removed from Sprint" on the Sprint Report

fields.description:
Currently only the owner or a jira-admin can do this. I think it would be good to allow this so you can have other team members adjust the settings.

Currently at my company there are multiple producers on a team that all use the same board and they would like to continue to have one board for the whole team.
fields.summary: Add the ability to specify multiple board administrators so other users can change the configuration (delegated admin)

fields.description: If I enter invalid input, even when it is ignored on blur, a warning appears regarding time input.
fields.summary: Warning about date formats showing after invalid input

fields.description:
The updated layout of JIRA notification emails is great.  What would make them even better is if you added a 'View on Board' link that works in the same way as those on the current web interface.

Users could then click to view the issue on the scrum board instead of going to the individual issue.
fields.summary: Add the Agile 'View on Board' link to JIRA notification emails
Scrum work board with time tracking poorly handles issues with time tracking hidden in field config

fields.description:
*SO THAT...* i don't have a massively long swimlane to scroll down when lots of issues were closed

*ASSUMPTIONS*
* there is little/no use having closed issues permanently displayed on the board. the board is used to move open issues
* the height of the page becomes even longer when the quick view is enabled, which means more scrolling down
* this feature is mainly useful for the DONE column which gets bigger as the sprint goes on. you may want to apply it to all columns, though i wouldn't personally want to use it for other columns as it may hide important information

*ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA*
* it is possible to vertically collapse/toggle visibility of the DONE column via an arrow at the top of the column, so that the height of the swimlane can be managed
* i can toggle column visibility on and off at the click of a mouse
* the height of the column is adjusted to the second longest column (displays all cards in that column)
fields.summary: As a rapid board user, I would like to be able to toggle the visibility the DONE column

fields.description:
Referencing the official documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Transitioning+an+Issue
it's currently *not possible to drag&drop multiple issues* in work mode.
We'd like to be able to use this feature to "bulk-move" deployed issues to the test column (just one use case.)

The request originated here:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/194081/drag-multiple-issues-in-greenhopper-transition
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to drag & drop multiple issues in work mode

fields.description:
When creating an epic from the Rapid Board's plan mode, the Create Epic screen appears. However, this screen only shows two fields which is *Epic Name* and *Summary*. [^Epic.jpg]

In order to show the other fields, the user must click on *Configure Fields* and then click on *All*.  [^ConfigureFields.jpg]

The *default visibility* of the fields should be configurable by administrators.
fields.summary: The Create Epic screen's fields should have configurable visibility

fields.description: On the Work board, it would be very helpful if we could add additional fields to each story card view. We have custom fields that we would like to be able to see without having to click on each issue individually.
fields.summary: Please allow additional fields to be viewed on Work view

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

Most fields from third-party plugins can't be added to GreenHopper as they don't fit in the field "sections" of GH.

i.e.: Scripted field from the Script Runner plugin

h3. Expected behaviour

We want to be able to add these field to a GH board.
fields.summary: As an user, I want to add fields from third-party plugins to JIRA Software
Document the default ranking for new Issues

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master and/or PM I want to be able to get easy access to filtering the Board backlog (Plan view) to fast and easily being able to drill down the options.

Possible alternative solutions:
- Being able to mark some quick filters as "Planning filters" which does not make sense on the Work view
- Get access to doing custom filtering like JIRA's search view within the Plan view


Personally I would prefer second option as the needs for filtering always change depending on context and adding Quick filters in the middle of planning is not efficient.
fields.summary: As a PM I want easy access to search filtering in Planning view

fields.description:
I got some stories bound to epics.

Problem is that I can not create subtask for a story (though I do it using Create subtask button - in plan mode). 

I got following error: "A subtask cannot be assigned to an epic." (and I try to create subtask for a story, not epic)

Check out the screenshot.

update:
I removed epic link from required fields and was finaly able to save the subtask.
fields.summary: Cannot create sub-task

fields.description:
When using the {{.}} (dot) menu to access the "Operations" menu for an issue, URLs for items that don't include a querystring are corrupted.

It looks like {{&returnUrl=...}} is indiscriminately appended to the URL for an item. This logic does not consider the case when a URL does not already include a querystring.

Steps to reproduce

# Browse to the rapid board and select an issue.
# Press {{.}} to open the Operations dialog.
# Search for {{Noti}} and wait for the "Notification Helper" suggestion to display.
# Right click the suggestion and choose "Open Link in New Tab" (or equivalent for your browser)

It's expected that the URL is:
{code}/notimportant?returnUrl=...{code}
but instead it's:
{code}/notimportant&returnUrl=...{code}

Note the {{?}} versus {{&}}

While the above example is fairly unimportant, this actually affects a JIRA feature I'm working on that allows fields to be added to an issue *from* the issue.
fields.summary: Issue operations item URLs are corrupted in the "." (shortcut) menu.

fields.description:
If we add a column which don't have any values in some issues but have in others, the alignment of the columns will be wrong. See screen shot:

!columns.png!
fields.summary: Problem in the Classic Planning Board alignment

fields.description: It would be nice if we could see the Sub-tasks in the *Epic Report*. Currently, we are only able to see the main issues under this report.
fields.summary: Sub-tasks are not visible on the Epic Report

fields.description:
As a scrum master or engineering manager, I would like to understand what portion of my team's velocity is new features versus other types of estimated work. 
--------

In our company, like many, we have not settled the debate on whether to estimate bugs with story points.  There are good reasons for both approaches and I'll leave it at that.

For the teams who choose to estimate bugs, it would be of great benefit to be able to configure the velocity chart to exclude bugs and other estimated issue types besides business stories in the computation of velocity.  

Better yet, the fraction of a team's time devoted to bugs is a valuable metric, and a stacked bar chart showing the component issue types of any given sprint velocity would be incredibly valuable.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure basis issues for velocity chart

fields.description:
Feature request for next releases.

Today we have sprint burn down chart that show the progress of a sprint.

It would very usefull to have product burn down chart that shows the progress of the entire project
fields.summary: Feature request: Product Burndown Chart

fields.description:
As per the screenshot that was shared by a user:
!auto_estimate.png|thumbnail!

The explanation to this suggestion is mentioned like the following:
{quote}
You have small team (6 - 8 persons). This team has sprint, but you do not want define sprint for each person. However, you need to know how much work (in time) is planned for each person in that team. When Issues are inserted to sprint, the values in current version of fields is calculated for all persons.

It would be great to have dynamically recalculation of these values on activating quick filter OR when quick filter is activated show just 3 new fields with "Not Started, In Progress and Done" which show times only of filtered issues.
{quote}

In the long run, this will be a helpful feature for those who make use of *Estimation Statistic* of Original Time Estimate, even Story Points for that matter whereby the usage of Quick Filters is making the estimation easier to calculate and to view.
fields.summary: Time Estimate auto-calculation via Quick Filters on the Scrum Plan Mode

fields.description:
*The Problem:*
Several customer show duplicated records on their database and though they might not be harmfull, they might cause future problems.

{code}
jira=> select * from fieldconfiguration where configname like '%Epic Name';
  id   |             configname              |               description               |      fieldid      | customfield 
-------+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------+-------------------+-------------
 10901 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |            
 11000 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |            
 11002 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |            
 11004 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |            
 11006 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |                   
 ....
on and on (292 rows)
.....          
 11328 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |            
 11329 | Default Configuration for Epic Name | Default configuration generated by JIRA | customfield_10801 |            
(292 rows)
{code}

Problem is related and was discovered when 'Epic Name' was found linked to 3 issuetypes: (this probably solved on startup tasks of: [GHS-6152|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6152])
{code}jira=> select * from fieldconfigschemeissuetype where fieldconfigscheme in (select id from fieldconfiguration where fieldid = 'customfield_10801');
  id   | issuetype | fieldconfigscheme | fieldconfiguration 
-------+-----------+-------------------+--------------------
 11849 |           |             11002 |              11330
 11314 |           |             11000 |              11081
 11846 | 3         |             10901 |              10901 (wrong)
 11847 | 7         |             10901 |              10901 (wrong)
 11848 | 5         |             10901 |              10901 
(5 rows)
{code}

We think this might be solved in a similar way.

There are other fields duplicated as well:
{code}
jira=> select configname, count(*) as count from fieldconfiguration group by configname having count(*) > 1 order by count desc;
                 configname                  | count 
---------------------------------------------+-------
 Default Configuration for Epic Name         |   292
 Default Configuration for Epic Status       |    38
 Default Configuration for External issue ID |     3
 Default Configuration for Issue Type        |     2
 Default Configuration for Rank              |     2
{code}
fields.summary: As a Support Engineer, I would like for 'Epic Name' field duplicated records to be automatically deleted.

fields.description:
We have several teams working on the same projects at different stages so we created a board made up of Epics only. We would then create stories for those epics in separate boards (team boards) linking to these Epics.

When doing so, I noticed an issue and I can't seem to fix it. In the plan list of these other boards in which I create the stories, the Epic Label does not show, however when you select the story for more info - the label shows there.

I tried various things to try and fix it but it seems to be a Jira display issue. This is very important since during planning meetign we need to see the stories split into the projects they relate to (Epics)  and not having the labels would mean we have to go through stories 1 by 1 to see what they're about.

Please refer to image attached.
fields.summary: Epic label not showing in Plan list when Epic is not in the same board.

fields.description:
We should use a pattern similar to the Reveal text pattern from the ADG.

* When there are more Quick Filters than there is horizontal screen space (eg. the screen is not wide enough, and they will wrap), we hide the remaining ones and display a "... Show more" link as the last Quick Filter.
* Clicking "... Show more" will reveal the rest of the Quick Filters
* "... Show more" will now change to say "Show less" instead
* The default state for all users is the collapsed state
* Whether the Filters are collapsed or all shown is persistent on a user level
* Reordering the Quick Filters stays the same as it is today
* When the header is collapsed (z on the keyboard), the behaviour stays the same.
fields.summary: Quick filters should collapse into a "... Show more" reveal pattern when they will wrap to more than one line

fields.description:
It would be handy to be able to define the list of options available in GreenHooper's right-click menu (both in _Plan_ and _Work_ modes), preferably for every Board separately.

*Example use cases:*
- assign issues to Sprints in a bulk (when board filter doesn't use ranking)
- bulk edit issues
- create sub-tasks
- transition issues through workflow
fields.summary: Ability to customize the right-click context menu

fields.description:
If you clone, the cloned tickets goes next the the position of the basic ticket.
Users want to select, where the new (cloned) ticket should be placed (in a current sprint or in the backlog).

Main Problem: If you clone a ticket in a running sprint, the reporting (Burn-Down) is completely destroyed. First effort is added and then reduced immediately, if you remove the cloned ticket (just in the same minute it is counted)
fields.summary: Clone a ticket should ask where to place new (cloned) ticket.

fields.description: A running Sprint can be reduced via the small triagnle (left tiny symbol - next to the sprint name). But this is not available for backlog or non started Sprints.
fields.summary: All Sprint should be recudeable with the small triangle
Customisable panels in the Backlog

fields.description:
In some instances, Epic-specific fields (Epic Status, Epic Name etc.) appear as assigned to other Issue Types, and so show up as Required in screens that are not relevant. This affects different Issue Types.
Example:
!epic1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround:
Restart Jira Instance (in most cases corrections scripts will run at the start and fix the problem)

If restart doesn't work try the workaround: [Epic Name field is required on Create Issue Screen for other Issue Types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Epic+Name+field+is+required+on+Create+Issue+Screen+for+other+Issue+Types]
fields.summary: Incorrect contexts for Epic related fields

fields.description:
As an enterprise user we don't use Fix Version's as we require a more robust solution.

Due to this we use 3 fields to track versions/branches:

|| Target Release(s) | Custom multi-select version field |
|| Integrated in Branch(es) | Custom multi-select field |
|| Verified in Branch(es) | Custom multi-select field |

While the latter two are not backed by versions, the "Target Release(s) is. We couldn't use the Fix Version/s field in JIRA for our solution because we track our fixes in branches and not in releases. (If renaming JIRA system field was possible this would be a lot easier, we would have renamed Fix Version/s and used that).

Do to setups like ours, where users track the version through a custom version field and not versions, we would like the ability to set the backing field for the "versions" tab/panel from Fix Version/s to a custom version field at a Global GreenHopper level (So new boards default to that field for versions).
fields.summary: As an enterprise user, I would like to be able to customize which field the 'versions' tab in GH points to

fields.description: [~mjopson] suggests we need to upgrade to Dropdown 2 since it appears OK on AUI sandbox
fields.summary: Gap between "Board" and menu on Retina screens

fields.description: It's necessary to have a better visual treatment in the Report View for Versions Report when all of the story points are done. Otherwise the customers get confused because they are used to see the "Today" vertical line and the last horizontal x-axis node labeled when the story points are not done yet.
fields.summary: It's necessary to have a better visual treatment in the Report View for Versions Report when all of the story points are done.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9544].
  {panel}

When creating an Epic, there is no characters limit in the Epic Name field, so we can create an Epic Name with, let's say, 40 characters.
However, when trying to edit this Epic, the field have a 30 characters limit, so we can't edit it, only delete the extra characters and use a 30 characters name.

It looks like the intention is to limit the field for 30 characters.  So the bug is to fix the creation of an Epic and add the restriction there, see original JAC ticket on limiting the Epic field:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6169
fields.summary: Inconsistency in the Epic Name field length restriction

fields.description:
*'g' + 'g' +* type *'da' + 'Enter'* 
=> gives "Plugins > General Configuration - Working Days" as well as "System > Defautl Dashboard"
=> RECOMMENDATION: change the GH shortcut
fields.summary: Admin shortcuts: GreenHopper Working Days duplicates JIRA Default Dashboard

fields.description:
In the Greenhopper list view, the columns of sub-task are slightly offset compared to the columns of top-level issues (see screen shots).

Steps to reproduce:
* Open a Greenhopper planning board, e.g. [in Jira's own issue tracker|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/VersionBoard.jspa?selectedBoardId=&pageType=PlanningBoard&subType=ComponentBoard&type=CB&selectedProjectId=10240&colPage=1]
* Enable the list view
* Find an item with sub-task, e.g. in Jira's own issue tracker there is currently one in the Unscheduled version on the first page
* For the sub-task and other issues, compare the alignment of columns to the right of the description. The task's columns have a slight offset to the left
fields.summary: Columns in sub-tasks misaligned in Greenhopper list view
Charts do not display a spinner

fields.description: In planning window, would like to be able to resolve an issue from the issue detail. Can do that now using "other actions" from drop down and typing in "resolve", but would be nice if one could add actions to the detailed view.
fields.summary: Add actions to detail view

fields.description:
Classic Boards are to be decommissioned, and using the Rapid Boards instead has been recommended since a long time now. However, in *Project Overview > Agile*, the charts are still based on Classic Boards (based on Versions and Contexts). This is a mixed signal on what we consider to be the major feature for Agile approach; and no quick similar solution is offered to users who want to track progress in the whole Project, not accounting for separate Sprints.

 That tab and included charts should be adjusted to use the Rapid Boards settings.
fields.summary: Agile tab in Project Overview based on Rapid Boards

fields.description:
It would be helpfull to see in a ticket details, where the tickets is connected to (in running sprint or backlog etc.).
Better would be to read next to that "View on Board" also the info itself. like: "Spint 20", "Backlog" etc.
perfect would be also which ranking (e.g. "Pos 2 - Backlog").

Currently you only see in the right (bottom): Agile "View on Board"
If you click on it, the item will be shown in the planing or in the board.
But you need to click to see.
fields.summary: Ticket Details: Agile - View on Board should show position in Spintlog/Back-log

fields.description:
Seen when reports are non-standard.

Icon has title/tooltip for when shown explaining non-standard settings
fields.summary: Update info icon to be iconfont

fields.description: Should use .aui-iconfont-help
fields.summary: Update the help icon on board column configuration page to be a font icon

fields.description: Please use .aui-iconfont-remove
fields.summary: Update trash icon to icon font (x) for delete column + delete status + delete sub-task

fields.description:
When looking at Backlog / Sprint (plan)
or 
When looking at Sprint(s) in work view on board

I would like to see progress bar on master task if it has sub-tasks without going into issue view.
Basically I would like to move "time tracking" from issue view to task display in board.
fields.summary: I would like to customize time tracking display on scrum boards

fields.description: This would include the ability to easily watch all issues under an epic
fields.summary: As a project manager, I would like to ability to watch an Epic

fields.description:
The Kanban board has a link called release. Clicking this will take all items in the done column and assign a fixVersion and remove them off the Kanban board. It would help if you could select items for a release. This could be achieved by using checkboxes to select the items to release and thus as a Release Manager I can select which items I would like to include in a particular release.

There should also be a select all check box that I can select all items.
fields.summary: As a release manager using the Kanban board I want to be able to select what issues are released and preview the items in the release

fields.description:
We are using oracle database server on which encoding is set to: WE8ISO8859P1

SELECT * FROM NLS_DATABASE_PARAMETERS WHERE PARAMETER = 'NLS_CHARACTERSET';
NLS_CHARACTERSET	WE8ISO8859P1

Encoding on db cannot be changed to UTF-8 because same db is used  for other applications that will get impacted because of this change.

With default behavior of JIRA if i enter double quotes “ or ”, they get converted into question mark ?

Since db is using this char set, we want to change JIRA to support same char set, to achieve this we have made change in following places:
1. JIRA DB: using this query
update propertystring set propertyvalue = 'ISO-8859-1' where id in (select id from propertyentry where property_key='webwork.i18n.encoding');

2. JIRA start up file (setenv.sh), added following line in jvm arguments
-Dfile.encoding=ISO-8859-1

3. Tomcat's conf/server.xml added encoding
URIEncoding="ISO-8859-1"

After these changes and bouncing JIRA, i could see change reflected in my browser and could see encoding is chnaged from UTF-8 to ISSO-8859-1.. but the problem of quotes getting converted to question mark is still there.. 

can you pls look into this and let me know what should be solution for this..
fields.summary: JIRA is converting few chars to question mark "?"

fields.description:

Try to use the keyboard shortcut for opening the Agile dropdown menu in firefox or chrome, (ALT+SHIFT+g), the keyboard shortcut doesn't work. 

*Other Notes*:

fields.description:
There were multiple improvement requests at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6030. The headings part was not addressed. Opening this new case for handling this:

*Screenshot from the original ticket*

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/71859/Screen%20Shot%202012-09-25%20at%205.13.44%20PM.png!
fields.summary: As a User I would like to see the burndown headings while scrolling down the burndown report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9512].
  {panel}

When trying to complete a sprint that has unresolved sub-tasks, instead of automatically removing these issues to the backlog Greenhopper gives error:

"Sprint cannot be completed as there are incomplete subtasks in the following issue: ..."

h2. Workarounds:
There are two possible workarounds for this problem:
* Manually remove those from the sprint - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Removing+an+Issue+from+a+Sprint
or
* Close off the subtask issue that's caught, then reopen it to put it in the next sprint
fields.summary: Unable to complete sprint because sub-task is not resolved
As an user, I want to search for Epics with tickets in an open sprint in the Issue Navigator

fields.description: Please provide an option to specify if a swimlane should display collapsed by default via a checkbox on the swimlane configuration screen (for query based simlanes)
fields.summary: I want an option to specify if a swimlane (query based) should display collapsed by default

fields.description:
When i click on "View issues in issue navigator" in Agile / GH board, it shows me following error

"Lexing failed on line: 7, column: 1, while reading '<', no possible valid JSON value or punctuation could be recognized."

 

Also after wards if i click on , isues link available in JIRA it shows me a error message: "The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down."

This time i also see following error in the logs catalina.out log file:

506x44265x1 mtwyf1 10.178.46.230,127.0.0.1 /rest/api/1.0/menus/find_link [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service

groovy.json.JsonException: Lexing failed on line: 7, column: 1, while reading '<', no possible valid JSON value or punctuation could be recognized.

        at groovy.json.JsonLexer.nextToken(JsonLexer.java:83)

        at groovy.json.JsonSlurper.parse(JsonSlurper.java:73)

        at groovy.json.JsonSlurper.parseText(JsonSlurper.java:59)

        at groovy.json.JsonSlurper$parseText.call(Unknown Source)

        at com.onresolve.jira.groovy.jql.IssuesInSprint.execMethod(script13729186275822048495194.groovy:117)

        at com.onresolve.jira.groovy.jql.IssuesInSprint.this$3$execMethod(script13729186275822048495194.groovy)

        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1850.invoke(Unknown Source)

        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)

        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)

 this is happening every time I follow these two steps, if i login and click on Issues link, it brings up all options properly.. 

Can you look into this issue..
fields.summary: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException (GH  v 6.2)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9499].
  {panel}

# A board is defined for a project X.
# A sprint is created and an issue in project X is added to it from the backlog.
# The same issue is now moved to a different project Y and so it no longer appears on the board but the Sprint field is still set for the issue.
# A User with project admin permission for project X but not project Y tries to close the sprint.  GreenHopper says that the moved issue in project Y is stopping the sprint from being completed because the user doesn't have project admin permission 
# If the user cannot edit the Sprint field directly there is no easy way to complete their sprint except to move the issue from Y back to X, view it in GreenHopper and use Remove from Sprint there, then move it back to Y
fields.summary: Moving issues can stop a sprint from being completed

Would be a big advantage, if subtickets also can be moved like main-tickets in a normal sprint or like in the backlog.

Thank you

Edit the documentation Greenhopper JIRA Configuration

fields.description: As a manager, I only want issues entered against a version that will actually ship. However, some teams want to have intermediate milestones within a release (such as a sprint or drop) and use that on their Agile boards. I want some ability to define a milestone and use it in addition to the version (like the hierarchy of versions that was available in the Classic board, but not an actual version that would show up in the Version drop down).
fields.summary: Add ability to define intermediate milestones outside of using versions (eg for Sprints, release milestones)

fields.description: I want to configure the fields that are displayed from the backlog so that I don't have to click into the issue to see details about them.
fields.summary: In the Plan view, want fields shown in backlog screen to be configurable

fields.description: In Version One, we could create a hierarchy of Epics, but we don't seem to have this capability in Greenhopper. Is this something that can be provided?
fields.summary: Ability to create a hierarchy of Epics instead of a single level

fields.description:
Hello,

I am the administrator of the account I work on as adussel.
I was working on Green Hopper for Jira, updating issues, and changing their status. Suddenly, my user (adussel) was not allowed anymore to change the issue (I can't reassigned, edit the issues anymore. but I was able do it 10 mn ago !)

Somebody must have change smth in your team about that...

Can you fix this very quickly, I have to work.... :(

Thx !!
fields.summary: administrator user permissions changed suddenly and is not able to perfom issue updates

fields.description:
The epic name/color are visible in "Plan" view of the Agile Board (scrum version, not sure about kanban), but don't show up on cards when in the "Work" view, only on the "card details" column if I click on a specific issue.

Adding it to the Cards view itself would be really helpful to help us arrange things together visually in our sprints.  At the moment, we're resorting to putting the epic as a prefix of every issue summary.
fields.summary: Show epic on cards in "work" view

fields.description:
from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-2268?focusedCommentId=490664&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-490664

[~njm] wrote:
Do you know of a way to JQL search for something that was flagged?
For instance, a Kanban team may use the flag on an issue (or several over time) and then want to look at their cycle time while excluding issues that were ever flagged. We can exclude the currently flagged issues with Flagged ~= Impediment.
Unfortunately Flagged WAS "Impediment" does not work as it is a 'Multi Checkboxes' custom field and they do not support WAS JQL (nor does the CHANGED clause).
fields.summary: As a user I would like to search for historically flagged issues using JQL

fields.description: In the Agile planning Version and I think Component hierarchies can be set up but there isn't really a simple way to do it when initially creating things.  This help a lot when organizing a project, especially components as well as Issues for Epic->Story relationships
fields.summary: It would be great to be able to easily create heirarchies of Issues, Components and Versions
Changing Saved Filter value in board configuration/Filter causes JS error

fields.description: Currently there is no mention of resolution field. However this sprint we developed functionality which allows for automatic update of resolution field in chosen statuses. Documentation on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+GreenHopper+Simplified+Workflow needs to be updated because of this work. Please refer to the parent issue for details.
fields.summary: Update GH Simplify Workflow documentation to include resolution description.

fields.description: name of status was coincidental
fields.summary: Error icon overlaps checkbox if someone on a different board deletes your status

fields.description:
We have a wide description or environment field (or the like):

https://jdog.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=279&view=detail&selectedIssue=DESK-337

For the result see the screenshot
fields.summary: Detail view shows horizontal scroll bar - scrolls text over sidebar

fields.description:
I would like to see multiple avatars for a Story in the Greenhopper Scrum Board's Work view.

In the current Work view, when we Pair Program on a story, there is no visibility of the second person in the pair.

Can GH be enhanced so that while a Story is still assigned to a single person, you can add the Pair Programmer to another field and have both avatars show in the Work view?

(At present, we need to use a physical wall to employ this feature.)
fields.summary: As a GH User, I would like to see Avatars for everyone working on the story

fields.description:
It would be great to able to view commit data in the Agile issue detail pane (perhaps with the comments or as a new tab), rather than having to leave the Agile view and go to the Issue Detail page.

Please see the attached screenshot, the commits show up in the detail pane but only provide the name of the commiter and nothing else
fields.summary: Show commits in Agile issue detail pane - regression

fields.description:
It would be nice if the gadgets (burndown gadget and days remaining gadget) would link back to the boards.

We are using these gadgets to create one dashboard to show information about all teams in our development department. Having a link to the board there would make it so much easier to find detail information about the sprint of one team.

My suggestion would be to make the Board name link to the planning board of the team, and the Sprint name to the sprint report of that sprint.
fields.summary: Make board name in gadgets link to boards

fields.description:
<web-resource key="gh-futureports-jira6x" name="GH AUI for JIRA6x Resources">
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-experimental-badge</dependency>
        <dependency>com.atlassian.auiplugin:aui-lozenge</dependency>
        <condition class="com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.conditions.IsAtLeastJiraVersion">
            <param name="majorVersion">6</param>
            <param name="minorVersion">0</param>
        </condition>
    </web-resource>
fields.summary: AUI Lozenge not working in gadgets in J6
When a swimlane header is stalked and the flagging is changed the header is not redrawn and leaves a gap until user scrolls

fields.description:
See screenshot.

Can be seen on JAC in the board configuration screen.
fields.summary: Double footer shown in JIRA 6.1 milestones
Editing the saved filter of a board results in JS error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-9418].
  {panel}

Repro:
1. Create a new sprint
2. Create a story with a subtask and add to the sprint
3. Start the sprint
4. DON'T COMPLETE THE STORY
5. In work mode, try to complete the sprint

Expected: completes and puts issues back into backlog

Actual: Error saying cannot complete due to incomplete subtasks

This works fine in JIRA 6.0 and below. If you have incomplete stories with incomplete subtasks you can complete the sprint. 

(complete stories with incomplete subtasks is expected behaviour but this is different)
fields.summary: JIRA 6.1: cannot complete sprint with open subtasks on open issue
The simplify dialog should show the resolution status selection on a subsequent screen

fields.description:
The Sprint Burndown Gadget can be configured to "Show board name", which is very helpful if you have multiple teams and want to create a dashboard to show information about all teams.

If there is no active sprint for a team there will only be a message "There are no active sprints", but the board name is not displayed anymore. This makes it difficult to see at a glance which team this gadget belongs to, see screenshot. This is especially confusing if you configure a wallboard to slide through the boards. In that case users can only see "There are no active sprints" for a few seconds which might be missunderstood as that there are no active sprints at all.

The gadget should show the board name in addition to the "There are no active sprints" error message.

This is also true for the "Remaining days" gadget.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadget should display board name even if there is no sprint

fields.description:
On Greenhopper in 'Plan' mode when a Story has sub tasks it lists the count of sub tasks next to the name of the story.

It would be useful if this also listed the 'points' for the story.
fields.summary: Work mode to include points as well as sub-task count
Putting issues from other projects under an epic

fields.description:
In an effort to try and reduce the amount of cogs in the top right corner of the screen, we should change the cog dropdown to be a simple AUI dropdown button, as seen here: https://developer.atlassian.com/design/buttons.html

The text for the button should read "Board" and the rest of the entries will remain as they are.
fields.summary: Change board configuration from a subtle button with an icon (cog) to be a simple dropdown button

fields.description:
Currently closed issues are just crossed out by the number of the issue.
This is quite hard to see in one view, which ones are really closed or not.

The closed issues should be marked by using user styles for highlighting.
E.g. cross out complete text and set the background to green etc.

If this is not already possible in the current version, please integrate that possibility to the future release of jira.

Thank you
fields.summary: Jira: Closed Issues should be formated in User style (for one quick overview)
The simplify workflow should show also unmapped statuses for selection.

fields.description: It should instead either remote it completely or show warning that this status is not mapped in the workflow at all.
fields.summary: When delete status from a board with same project, the original board shows error

fields.description:
When adding or editing components on a particular issue/card, a refresh to that page is required before an added component can be added to the list.

Likewise, removed components remain in the list until a page refresh...making it possible to enter orphaned data.

Even though the dropdown for components appears to be AJAX, the data isn't in line with what's current for the project.
fields.summary: Changes to components in project admin requires refresh on card for use

fields.description:
A user should be able to choose the maximum value of the Y-axis of the Cumulative Flow Diagram to display for clarity purposes.

A simple but effective use case is this:
# Imagine having a CFD with the following parts: [^Part1.PNG] and [^Part2.PNG]
# In [^Part2.PNG], because of that single line in which the data spikes up, the scale of the Y-Axis stretches up to a very high number. 
# This causes the other parts of the graph to be too small to view properly, as we can see in [^Part1.PNG]. The only workaround is to manually zoom the browser itself.
fields.summary: Y-Axis of Cumulative Flow Diagram should be configurable for clarity purposes
